title: Updating Postage Cost For Adoptions
text: The pricing is per item, per service/area, per from and to weight, and so there is a lot of data to sift through to know what to change. Therefore, you may want to make sure all items have the same price for the service/area and from and to weight, and then just view one item, as I have done in the SQL below. You can send the results of the second query to the customer to ask them to fill in the New Price column. This table is on the webserver NOT the customer database. SELECT * FROM PostageServiceBand a JOIN PostageBand ON pbID=psbPbID JOIN PostageService ON psID=psbPsID JOIN PostageServiceBarcode b ON a.psbPsID=b.psbPSID JOIN BarCodes ON bcdId=psbBCDID JOIN PriceLookups ON bcdPLURecNo=pluRecNo WHERE bcdCode='memb1' -- Comment this line out if you want to see the price for all items ORDER BY bcdCode, pbFrom, psID SELECT pluShortDesc [PLU Short Description], bcdCode [Barcode], psName [Service Name], pbFrom [From Weight], pbTo [To Weight], psbPrice [Price], '' [New Price] FROM PostageServiceBand a JOIN PostageBand ON pbID=psbPbID JOIN PostageService ON psID=psbPsID JOIN PostageServiceBarcode b ON a.psbPsID=b.psbPSID JOIN BarCodes ON bcdId=psbBCDID JOIN PriceLookups ON bcdPLURecNo=pluRecNo WHERE bcdCode='memb1' -- Comment this line out if you want to see the price for all items ORDER BY psID, pbFrom, bcdCode This is the SQL to update the various prices SELECT * INTO BAKPostageServiceBand19Jan2024 FROM PostageServiceBand BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE a SET psbPrice=3 FROM PostageServiceBand a JOIN PostageBand ON pbID=psbPbID JOIN PostageService ON psID=psbPsID JOIN PostageServiceBarcode b ON a.psbPsID=b.psbPSID JOIN BarCodes ON bcdId=psbBCDID JOIN PriceLookups ON bcdPLURecNo=pluRecNo WHERE psbPrice=2.25 AND psName='UK Standard Delivery' AND pbFrom=0.001 AND pbTo=0.05 --COMMIT BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE a SET psbPrice=7.75 FROM PostageServiceBand a JOIN PostageBand ON pbID=psbPbID JOIN PostageService ON psID=psbPsID JOIN PostageServiceBarcode b ON a.psbPsID=b.psbPSID JOIN BarCodes ON bcdId=psbBCDID JOIN PriceLookups ON bcdPLURecNo=pluRecNo WHERE psbPrice=7.40 AND psName='UK Courier' AND pbFrom=0.001 AND pbTo=0.05 --COMMIT BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE a SET psbPrice=4.75 FROM PostageServiceBand a JOIN PostageBand ON pbID=psbPbID JOIN PostageService ON psID=psbPsID JOIN PostageServiceBarcode b ON a.psbPsID=b.psbPSID JOIN BarCodes ON bcdId=psbBCDID JOIN PriceLookups ON bcdPLURecNo=pluRecNo WHERE psbPrice=4.00 AND psName='EU' AND pbFrom=0.001 AND pbTo=0.05 --COMMIT BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE a SET psbPrice=5.50 FROM PostageServiceBand a JOIN PostageBand ON pbID=psbPbID JOIN PostageService ON psID=psbPsID JOIN PostageServiceBarcode b ON a.psbPsID=b.psbPSID JOIN BarCodes ON bcdId=psbBCDID JOIN PriceLookups ON bcdPLURecNo=pluRecNo WHERE psbPrice=4.75 AND psName='Rest of World' AND pbFrom=0.001 AND pbTo=0.05 --COMMIT
description:
The pricing is per item, per service/area, per from and to weight, and so there is a lot of data to sift through to know what to change. Therefore, you may want to make sure all items have the same price for the service/area and from and to weight, and then just view one item, as I have done in the SQL below.


You can send the results of the second query to the customer to ask them to fill in the New Price column.


This table is on the webserver NOT the customer database. 




SELECT * FROM PostageServiceBand a
JOIN PostageBand ON pbID=psbPbID
JOIN PostageService ON psID=psbPsID
JOIN PostageServiceBarcode b ON a.psbPsID=b.psbPSID
JOIN BarCodes ON bcdId=psbBCDID
JOIN PriceLookups ON bcdPLURecNo=pluRecNo
WHERE bcdCode='memb1'  -- Comment this line out if you want to see the price for all items
ORDER BY bcdCode, pbFrom, psID

SELECT pluShortDesc [PLU Short Description], bcdCode [Barcode], psName [Service Name], pbFrom [From Weight], pbTo [To Weight], psbPrice [Price], '' [New Price] FROM PostageServiceBand a
JOIN PostageBand ON pbID=psbPbID
JOIN PostageService ON psID=psbPsID
JOIN PostageServiceBarcode b ON a.psbPsID=b.psbPSID
JOIN BarCodes ON bcdId=psbBCDID
JOIN PriceLookups ON bcdPLURecNo=pluRecNo
WHERE bcdCode='memb1' -- Comment this line out if you want to see the price for all items
ORDER BY  psID, pbFrom, bcdCode


This is the SQL to update the various prices


SELECT * INTO BAKPostageServiceBand19Jan2024 FROM PostageServiceBand

BEGIN TRANSACTION 
UPDATE a
SET psbPrice=3
FROM PostageServiceBand a
JOIN PostageBand ON pbID=psbPbID
JOIN PostageService ON psID=psbPsID
JOIN PostageServiceBarcode b ON a.psbPsID=b.psbPSID
JOIN BarCodes ON bcdId=psbBCDID
JOIN PriceLookups ON bcdPLURecNo=pluRecNo
WHERE psbPrice=2.25 AND psName='UK Standard Delivery' AND pbFrom=0.001 AND pbTo=0.05
--COMMIT 

BEGIN TRANSACTION 
UPDATE a
SET psbPrice=7.75
FROM PostageServiceBand a
JOIN PostageBand ON pbID=psbPbID
JOIN PostageService ON psID=psbPsID
JOIN PostageServiceBarcode b ON a.psbPsID=b.psbPSID
JOIN BarCodes ON bcdId=psbBCDID
JOIN PriceLookups ON bcdPLURecNo=pluRecNo
WHERE psbPrice=7.40 AND psName='UK Courier' AND pbFrom=0.001 AND pbTo=0.05
--COMMIT

BEGIN TRANSACTION 
UPDATE a
SET psbPrice=4.75
FROM PostageServiceBand a
JOIN PostageBand ON pbID=psbPbID
JOIN PostageService ON psID=psbPsID
JOIN PostageServiceBarcode b ON a.psbPsID=b.psbPSID
JOIN BarCodes ON bcdId=psbBCDID
JOIN PriceLookups ON bcdPLURecNo=pluRecNo
WHERE psbPrice=4.00 AND psName='EU' AND pbFrom=0.001 AND pbTo=0.05
--COMMIT 

BEGIN TRANSACTION 
UPDATE a
SET psbPrice=5.50
FROM PostageServiceBand a
JOIN PostageBand ON pbID=psbPbID
JOIN PostageService ON psID=psbPsID
JOIN PostageServiceBarcode b ON a.psbPsID=b.psbPSID
JOIN BarCodes ON bcdId=psbBCDID
JOIN PriceLookups ON bcdPLURecNo=pluRecNo
WHERE psbPrice=4.75 AND psName='Rest of World' AND pbFrom=0.001 AND pbTo=0.05
--COMMIT

JOIN PostageService ON psID=psbPsID
JOIN PostageServiceBarcode b ON a.psbPsID=b.psbPSID
JOIN BarCodes ON bcdId=psbBCDID
JOIN PriceLookups ON bcdPLURecNo=pluRecNo
WHERE psbPrice=4.00 AND psName='EU' AND pbFrom=0.001 AND pbTo=0.05
--COMMIT 

BEGIN TRANSACTION 
UPDATE a
SET psbPrice=5.50
FROM PostageServiceBand a
JOIN PostageBand ON pbID=psbPbID
JOIN PostageService ON psID=psbPsID
JOIN PostageServiceBarcode b ON a.psbPsID=b.psbPSID
JOIN BarCodes ON bcdId=psbBCDID
JOIN PriceLookups ON bcdPLURecNo=pluRecNo
WHERE psbPrice=4.75 AND psName='Rest of World' AND pbFrom=0.001 AND pbTo=0.05
--COMMIT
